photo.description: 1,056,006 of those Swedish tiles cover the Opera House, in Sydney. Although many people think they are all the same colour, they are not: some are glossy white and others are matte cream coloured. 1056006 desses azulejos suecos cobrem a Opera de Sydney. Embora muitos pensem que a cor é uniforme, não é o caso: alguns são branco brilhante e outros creme fosco.
photo.title: Opera House Tiles

photo.title: STOP

photo.description: It's more than an Opera house. Uploaded for the Country Landmark thread in: www.flickr.com/groups/class/ Sydney Opera House - Feb 2007 Canon 350D (RebelXT) with Tokina 12-24 (F4) (18-36mm EQ 35 ))Lens. ISO 400, 1/30 @ F4, Focal lengh =12mm (18mm equivalent). Hand Held. Why. 12-24 Lens it is a good city walk around lens - where you want to capture the scene. Also is not too intrusive. ISO = 400 - Reasonable qiality in lowish light setting that also allow hand holding. Speed = 1/30 - Lowest I felt that would overcome camera shake. Aperture = F4 I Felt it would give me enough depth of field (sharpness between forground and background) with the current ISO. Focal Length = 12mm - I like the POV it gave me Hand held - because I was a tourist in my own with family and friends (non photographers) Pic was PP in CS2 to lighten up the foreground.

photo.description: Taken quite some time ago now on an old cheap camera. Was amazed at how well the shot came out. Was taken around 1996 I think. Just around the time Crowded House was to play their last ever gig at this very venue... outside! Yes that's almost 10 years now gone by! Amazing eh? As for the Geo Mapping on this pic (you'll find that to the right of this pic) it's fairly accurate as to the positioning of this photo to about (approx) 10 metres.
photo.tags: sydney opera house soh australia nsw newsouthwales explore 1996 sydneyoperahouse دار الأوبرا في سيدني 悉尼歌剧院 όπερα シドニーオペラハウス 시드니 오페라 하우스 сиднейский оперный театр โรงอุปรากรซิดนีย์ binası nhà сіднейський оперний operahousedisydney सिडनी ओपेरा हाउस
photo.title: Postcard Opera House

photo.description: Approximately 10 years ago I took a shot of the Sydney icon using a $16 camera and after posting it on Flickr many years later I later enjoyed much success. It sits today on Explore at #50 and of all photos tagged sydneyoperahouse it ranks #15 out of 7000 odd pics. Today I went to our famous harbour in an effort to recreate that now famous shot using digital. It still looks good in digital but that glow that film possesses is missing I think. What do you think?

photo.description: Byl ještě chladný večer, takhle na začátku jara v Sydney. Šel jsem z pohovoru do nové práce. Oči unavené, zrak můj slabý, takhle nějak jsem viděl Opera House. A myšlenky mi lítaly všude možně, neklidně. Čekají nás s Miškou velké změny...
- Taken at 8:52 PM on December 23, 2009 - uploaded by ShoZu

photo.description: we actually went to a show at the opera house. zoe's idea. not opera, theater - shakespeare - richard III. it was raining. i was worried i was going to be underdressed because i only had five shirts and two pairs of pants, but it turned out to be ok.
photo.tags: worldtour australia sydney sydneyoperahouse rain blurry

photo.description: We're a proud bunch. We love our sun. We love our sport and our sporting heroes. But we are not famous for being a... how could you put it... cultured lot. But thanks to Utzon's designed Opera House and many years of hard work by a dedicated (and possibly homesick lot of Europeans) art loving lot, Australia's work in the arts has come along in leaps and bounds. If only you could see what Sydney looked like in the 50's and 60's!
photo.tags: sydney sydneyoperahouse soh nsw newsouthwales australia 2007 opera house explore blue landmark modern architech
photo.title: Sydney's Favourite House
